# llms.txt

project: Dokistry
type: open-source-software
license: MIT
status: active
languages_supported: 20
created: 2025

## Description
Dokistry is a modern web interface designed to simplify the management of self-hosted Docker registries.
It provides a unified experience to manage multiple registries, inspect images and tags, manage users,
and clean up unused resources efficiently.

The project and its website are fully translated into 20 languages to support an international community.

## Key Features
- Manage multiple self-hosted Docker registries from a single interface
- Detailed image inspection (metadata, tag sizes, disk usage)
- Tag inspection and analysis
- Delete tags directly from the UI
- Multi-registry support
- User and access management with administrator privileges
- Modern React-based user interface
- Easy self-hosted deployment
- Multilingual interface (20 languages)

## Target Audience
- Developers
- DevOps engineers
- System administrators
- Teams running private Docker registries

## Usage Context
Dokistry is used to streamline daily Docker registry administration, improve visibility into stored images,
and reduce disk usage by removing unused tags and images.

## Openness
- 100% Open Source
- MIT licensed
- Community-driven and contribution-friendly
- International community

## Technology
- Frontend: React
- Domain: Docker, Containers, DevOps, Registry Management

## Internationalization
- Multilingual UI and website
- 20 supported languages
- Community-driven translations
